reviewText: It'a a real good story and a really good performance of Goldblum and Whitaker. What can I say. I'm pianist and I love Jazz

Maybe it's because AMERICANS are all caught in the "CHITTLIN' CIRCUIT HIP HOP TEENY BOPPER AGE"! In short; STUPID!! A great movie I've searched High & Low for and it's available in REGION 4 format?? VERY COOWELL flick with great performances and music! Too deep for STUPID AMERICAN audiences! I WANT THIS MOVIE! ....Peace.

Lush Life [ NON-USA FORMAT, PAL, Reg. 4 Import - Australia ] IT TRULY BOGGLES MY MIND THAT A PRODUCTION OF THIS STATURE COULD GO VIRTUALLY UNNOTICED AND UNAPPRECIATED. I FIRST SAW IT ON PREMIUM CABLE TV ABOUT 8 YEARS AGO AND IT BLEW ME AWAY. ONE DOESN'T HAVE TO BE A JAZZ AFICIONADO TO DIG IT BUT IT HELPS. JEFF GOLDBLOUM AND FOREST WHITAKER GIVE OUTSTANDING PORTRAYALS OF TWO NEW YORK STUDIO MUSICIANS WHO PLAY MUSICAL GARBAGE EVERYDAY SO THAT THEY CAN OCCASIONALLY DELVE INTO THE MUSIC THEY LOVE, JAZZ! THE STORY ITSELF ISN'T ONE OF EPOCH PROPORTIONS BUT IT TELLS A TALE OF WONDROUS DELIGHT. KATHY BAKER AND A HOST OF MARVELOUS MUSICIANS MAKE THIS A MOVIE THAT YOU SHOULD NOT BE FORCED TO MISS. HERE'S HOPING SOME DVD MOGUL HAS THE GUTS AND GOOD SENSE TO RELEASE THIS MOVIE IN REGION 1 MODE.

MAYBE  YOU CAN TELL US  . . .  Just what the Hell

  good is a 15 year-old movie

  RELEASE IN A REGION 4 FORMAT ??

  THIS  IS  SO  DAMN  STUPID  !!  It wouldn't play on

  anything that I own.
